Starting at the age of 13, with my mother’s first bout with cancer of the throat, I’ve watched and assisted way too many people down the road of discovery, treatment (sometimes successful, sometimes not) and whatever the outcome may be – a return to health, or the finality of death.
Eighteen years ago, in 2001, I know that my reactions to loss, cancer, and death were far more heightened than they are now.

Had been separated 11 years,you have to be at least 4 out of the previous 5 years living apart here before you can apply for a divorce, nothing to contest, house I lived in was mine and he had no interest in the children,he had run up a lot of date but I had cleared that in the first 5 years of our separation, so it was simply a matter of filling out the paperwork, paying to get a solicitor to notarise them and about 5 mins in front of a judge, he wasnt even there.
